title: Conceptual Change Teaching Strategy Simulation Training to Improve Misconceptions About Matter Composition

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary science education theory, foundational pedagogy, VR/simulation learning tool experience
context.additional_context: Simulation-based training process where pre-service teachers recognize misconceptions occurring during elementary school matter composition education, apply concept change strategies, and facilitate transitions to scientifically coherent concepts

learning_goals: Prospective teachers can classify and explain at least three types of misconceptions elementary students have about the composition of matter.
Learners can effectively implement the Conceptual Change Teaching Strategy Model (Exploration-Conflict-Reconstruction-Application) in a VR simulation environment.
Learners can design at least two customized feedback strategies to scientifically correct misconceptions.

resources: Misconception Case Database on Material Composition
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
